attributes.action: make the United Kingdom more democratic by adopting a federal system of government
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Britain portrays itself as a front running in establishing, and maintaining democracy; even attempting to promote it throughout the work, but the 'upper-house' of the British government is not even elected. 

Establishing a Federal system of government in Britain would also solve the issue of Scottish, Welsh, and Northern Ireland's devolution of powers. 

A Parliamentary democracy and constitutional monarchy is not appropriate for this century, and it could be argued that it is completely undemocratic.

rejection.details: Matters involving Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland are a matter for the appropriate Executives/Assembly.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
